website_summaries.verdict: Basic design in a bicycle cargo rack, simplifying the installation process.
pros: Consists of an aluminum alloy that's durable and lightweight
Includes padding that protects the bike from scratches
Length of cargo rack is adjustable to accommodate different loads
Design allows for quick removal and installation
cons: Not made for heavy loads, as its weight limit is 22 pounds of cargo

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: P.O.S. it broke after 2 weeks of using it. Never put more than 10-12 pounds on it and the cheap aluminum just snapped under the bouncing and about 10-12 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: JeffinGH

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 15 days worth of riding.
customer_reviews.text: 30 hours of road time using this rack and only ever carrying a 10lb. load. Snapped off clean on where it was welded together. Luckily my wife was just taking it off the stand and not biking down the road at night. Don't buy. Avoid for your own safety.
customer_reviews.author: CampFire83

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, and worked better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with these light duty racks. We puchased some nylon touring bags that were recommended at the bottom of the item listing and they worked just fine. Just take note that these are light duty with only about a 10lb capacity. If you're planning on carrying anything heavier, dole out some more cash and get the appropriate rack.
customer_reviews.author: CamRam

customer_reviews.title: Great for my bike!
customer_reviews.text: So far I like this allot. Wasn't very difficult to assemble on my own once I realized how the screws should be placed. Doesn't move or sway or even shake as I'm riding my bike along the canal trails (not paved) which are pretty bumpy. I didn't put the max weight on it but I was able to carry everything I needed for my bike ride. (Extra Shirt, light snacks, bike pump, flashlight ect.) I didn't even need to use bungee cords to hold the bag I strapped onto this. So far this has been a great addition to a bike I love so much!
customer_reviews.author: Star Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says.  No, you can't use it as a second passenger seat.  Don't even try.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, slim very elegant rear rack for holding light items only. Don't overload it. I only gave it four stars fo ease of install not because it is hard to install, but because it is not the easiest thing to mount a rear reflector or brake light to due to its rounded end shape. Something they should consider when redeigning this product for future improvements would be making the back edge have a flat section or a through-hole mount for popular common brake lights and reflectors.
customer_reviews.author: MattGuyver

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it wouldn't be as strong as I wanted but I was wrong! This held alot of weight and very well built! Love it and would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a bike mount.
customer_reviews.author: Blake A. Wertz

customer_reviews.title: Great bike rack.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several types of bike racks for my son's bike. This is the only brand that actually works. The rest have been too wobbly. I can hook a bike basket on the back of the rack and it works great. The only downside to this product is the bike rack can slide off the back if the screws come loose so I add a zip tie and hook the rack to the bike seat just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Davis Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, But very narrow!!!
customer_reviews.text: I attached this to my bike seat using it for transporting shoebox sized packages to my local UPS drop off point. This rack is WAY to narrow for any type of box. The boxes I use it for are almost always 12x10x6 and they fall off everytime even when secured with a bungee cord. I ended up cutting a piece of 1x10, drilling holes in it and zip tying it to the rack then spraying it with plasti-dip. Now it works great but only because of my modifications. Overall this isn't good for anything.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Nice rack
customer_reviews.text: I like this carrier. I would give it a better rating if it fit my seat post better. I happen to have a very fat post and I can only get 2 of the 4 screws in to secure it. Longer screws would not help, the holes will not align. It is sturdy the way it is and just what I wanted so I didn't send it back. I would add that they need to include in their description the largest diameter post it fits.
customer_reviews.author: NancyT2U

customer_reviews.title: Well built but covers up my reflective light under the seat.
customer_reviews.text: This rack looks well made and easy to install. My problem was besides it covered up my reflective light under the seat, it also has 2 metal screws that look like they would scratch my tire fender every time I hit a bump. These screws are to extend the rack longer but should have been some kind of rubber or something else. I don't want my reflective light covered up or scratches so I returned it. I have a 7 speed cruiser so maybe this fits another make/model.
customer_reviews.author: Rosarita

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy. I ride 4 mi to work and back each day and use this to carry everything I need so I don’t have to wear a backpack. I’m sure I’ve exceeded the 22lb limit at points but it’s held up! I also go on 60 mile occasional bike rides with my husband and use this to hold both our stuff and it hasn’t faile or bent or twisted on our bumpy road rides.
customer_reviews.author: Layne and Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This rack has met my needs. I have a large E-bike from DJ bikes that has a battery right behind the seat, and a fender that goes above the rear tire along with mechanical disk brakes so I needed something that would be able to install around all of this stuff. It works great and is able to handle a lot of weight, no problems with it at all so far and have had it on for about 700 miles now. It was a little tough for me to install but this was also my first install on one of these, so it could have simply been the installer and not necessarily the product ;)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher K. Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Tends to want to twist around the post if you don't crank it down real tight, but I am honestly concerned I'll strip the threads if I go much further. However, for my fat-tire bike with its 190mm dropouts, the only other frame-mounted options that I was sure would fit with $200+, so I am very happy with the money I spent on this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but unhandy.
customer_reviews.text: Takes awhile to mount so installing and removing will take longer than a clampdown rack. It doesn't have a reflector or a reflector mount. Seems sturdy enough to carry the recommended weight. I have a bag mounted on mine that requires a longer high sweep of the leg to clear it when mounting the bike.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: if your only like putting a couple of things
customer_reviews.text: piece can stand a couple of pounts, after that it will bend. Advice for you guys, invest 20 more bucks on a more durable and reliable one. With this one, dont tell me that you wont put heavy stuff eventually. if your only like putting a couple of things, then its ok
customer_reviews.author: LGJ7

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. The shims helped with the installation
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. The shims helped with the installation. It fits well on my Nike with a comfort seat.
customer_reviews.author: drsiv

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, very sturdy and also acts as a mud guard for rear wheel of the bike. My subdivision mail box it about a mile from the house, so this is how I picked up mails/boxes, mostly from amazon.com. Just a couple of bungie cords to tie the box to the rack and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis T.

customer_reviews.title: Description unclear, product felt flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Build quality felt cheap, but appropriate for the price. Description is unclear when it came to what size seat post it will fit. Description says 10-12.6 inch diameter post. That does not make sense at all, unless your seat post is the size of a gallon paint can. I believe it has the decimal point at the wrong spot and should read 1.0-1.26 inch diameter post. As it said it will fit on most seat posts, I took a risk on trying to fit it on my 1.56 diameter (3.9 cm) post. It didn’t fit. The screws are too close together and cannot pass to reach the threads on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lung

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & simple
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd rack I've tried from these Chinese Amazon & ebay suppliers and this is my favorite. Good quality
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient design with fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: Convenient design, but only lasted seven months before it broke clean off. Never exceeded the weight recommendation, though the bike has been on some bumpy terrain before. If they made the metal a little thicker on the main shaft this would have been amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jondotcom

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but tends to loosen
customer_reviews.text: Product works fine, but I had to tighten the clamp screws several times. Finally had to use some lock tight. Also, it probably works good for steel or alloy post, but I was afraid to really tighten it down on a composite post. Had to add a bracket to support the back, but probably would not be required on a stronger seat post.
customer_reviews.author: chgfhghgcg

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice rig option for extra carry capacity
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice rig option for extra carry capacity. It installs using a hex key. Even if you have a rack on your rear fender, this can be used as a 2-story layer to add on with. It can situate anywhere up and down the seat stem. I have a foldable bike and it's all good.
customer_reviews.author: NYShopper

customer_reviews.title: Load Bearer
customer_reviews.text: Comes in handy during these days when you need an extra hand or should I say storage area. Needed this accessory to help me when delivering Food Delivery orders. Load my Cooler or Hot bag, Secure it and off we go.
customer_reviews.author: N-Scene Photography

customer_reviews.title: Needs instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great product but no instructions and we had to drill into the bike frame because there were no c-brackets to attach it to the frame. Small inconvenience but it's well made and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Willard

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, it slides
customer_reviews.text: Sleek , slim , solid , secure ,sturdy , it slides , I'm sold !!!!!! If you want to carry very heavy loads buy a rack that braces at the bottom but for an average load it's very strong !!!!! Fits right between my sissy bar.
customer_reviews.author: BKLYN

customer_reviews.title: Works great stays in place and holds my gear
customer_reviews.text: Works great stays in place and holds my gear. Really happy with this item. Would buy again if I needed another one.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: rack for smaller size bikes
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife's bike as she is only 5' 4" and her Trek hybrid bike did not have room for a regular rack. This one fit nicely but had a limited weight restriction. You also need to get a smaller bag to fit on it because regular ones are too big. I found a Rosewell that fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike rack, I had a hard time finding a Bike rack that fit my electric fat bike without interfering with the disc brakes or attaching to the seatpost this worked great im very pleased... I had even gone to a bike shop and they told me they had no racks that would fit my bike
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Rack
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to purchase this rack for my Trek hi-bred. However, I have been very pleased with my purchase. It looks great and functions well for transporting small items.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Nice clean look on the bike. haven't loaded it yet but its on and feels solid. Not heavy. will be nice for day trippin with some light gear and snacks instead of humping it on my back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks at the stem
customer_reviews.text: Seems they have a tendency to break about half an inch from weld. Mine lasted 1 year and 3 months of everyday use, which is pretty good, but now I see others broken in exactly the same place. They seem to have an consistent issue. I will try another brand
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, exactly as expected. You need someone else to help install if you're going to use the rubber pads, but I didn't need them so it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: chris muthig

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back! It felt cheaply made as if it would break. Rather than keep it, I decided to send it back and just use the rack which was on my mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Zap

customer_reviews.title: Well made rear rack for bike.
customer_reviews.text: The high quality of this device was surprising. I have not installed it yet on my bike, but it looks like a very strong and well made piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: C. N. Seger

customer_reviews.title: Great for leisure, or transit. Not for trail riding.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to put on my 26" MTB worked great, how ever you do need to be cautious of rough terrain when carrying cargo on it. It has a 22lbs max I was carrying about 15lbs while riding on some rough trails, after going over a decent drop (about 10-12 inches) the main shaft that attached to seat post snapped. I highly recommend this rack it is ideal for riding in transit, or leisure but I don't recommend for trail biking. It is very well constructed while being light weight.
customer_reviews.author: THEJOSH

customer_reviews.title: It's OK, but angles down over the tire.
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike rack. I don't care how it's angled down and not straight across over the rear tire. I my order a different brand and give this away.
customer_reviews.author: Rubble

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to mount as well
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned about it being unstable with heavy load and swaying around, but so far no issues at all! Very easy to mount as well.
customer_reviews.author: ata0318

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need.......thanks!!!
customer_reviews.text: This extendable bike rack fits my scooter perfectly and carries my rack pack while looking stylish!!! I needed a rack like this because my scooter doesn't have any rack attachment points like some bicycles. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.author: 50yearsyoung

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit for Trek 4300
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit my Trek 4300. Had to remove my reflector. Doesn't fit under the seat very well. If you ride with your seat low, it will not fit. No instructions with product.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L.

customer_reviews.title: Remember these two things and you’ll be happy. Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Five stars at the price and weight limit advertised. Remember these two things and you’ll be happy. Easy to install, as promised. But again, it’s not for heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Very good rack!
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my full suspension bike which makes me able to put heavier loads than they recommend. I actually tried putting half my weight on it and it held strong. I'm 150 lb!
customer_reviews.author: Amazn Shoperz 6

customer_reviews.title: Rack performed beautifully and was a cinch to install
customer_reviews.text: Just finished a 200+ mile Katy Trail trip with this rack on my Trek 3700 series mountain bike. Rack performed beautifully and was a cinch to install. I didn't push the weight rating of 22 pounds (my gear weighed in at just over 10 pounds), but the rack could have easily handled the full 22. I would definitely recommend. Only improvement would be a quick release clamp instead of the two-piece clamp that requires four screws.
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: Can hold ten pounds.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to carry a trumpet And lightweight case, one bump and it sheered right off behind the weld joint. Low strength aluminum alloy.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Aesthetics and a proper amount of functionality for the average commuter
customer_reviews.text: Great for short commutes and loads. It only holds around 20-35 lbs so you're not going to be hauling any heavy duty items with this. I use it for small groceries and trips to the post office. Assembly was a breeze, just make sure to properly tighten all parts. Looks streamlined and cool on my frame. I would suggest to anyone who is interested in aesthetics and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: John Henson

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK ON STRAIGHT  SEAT POSTS
customer_reviews.text: if your bike has a straight up and down seat post this item will not work for you The rack will stick straight up in the air and is useless they don't tell you that tho
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Works well and looks good
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my granddaughter’s bike. She can take her stuff to the park without having to wear a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: P. Jones

customer_reviews.title: This is a very stylish and easy to install bicycle utility
customer_reviews.text: This is a very stylish and easy to install bicycle utility; however, because the mount takes up about 2" of the seat tube, this could sacrifice the space necessary for mounting a rear reflector, depending upon one's height. The rack does not have an alternative, convenient mounting point for a reflector.
customer_reviews.author: Dieter Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Awesome universal bike rack
customer_reviews.text: This bike rack has been able to with my grocery shopping and stays in place; it even fit on my e-bike with a giant battery behind/underneath the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Ebiker

customer_reviews.title: Light weight items only.
customer_reviews.text: It fits well and looks good but don't use it for anything close to its weight limit. I was carrying a battery that was just under it's limit and when I dropped down from a curb, it split right next to the seat. I had to have a welding friend put it back together and reinforce it to carry my battery.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Keith Ames

customer_reviews.title: Good rack.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Fits nicely. Seems sturdy. I put this on my wife's 26 inch bicycle, but it can be adjusted easily for a variety of sizes. When the weather gets warm, we'll strap a pet carrier to this so my wife can take her dog bike riding with us The reason I gave it four stars instead of five is that I felt the instructions weren't very clear.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: another item I bought for my father for his motorized bicycle. According to him this product was extremely useful. Considering he doesn't have a vehicle, his motorized bike is his form of transportation. This made it much easier for him to ride right up the street for groceries instead of struggling to walk home with them. Great product & it was delivered in less than 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Gionti

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: After searching for a retractable cargo carrier, I finally found one that fits my style. Great product with weight restrictions. 22lbs, but don't push your limits and keep the weight at under 18lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: It held up just fine. I never had any movement of the rack ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for, of all things a urban and trail mix beer ride. It held a small soft sided cooler all day starting out with a 12 pack of cans and plenty of ice on the rack. It held up just fine. I never had any movement of the rack and it supported the weight without any issues. A great rack for a really affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: David S

customer_reviews.title: High quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: High quality for the price. Better instructions would be nice. One has to guess what the four rubber rectangles are for.
customer_reviews.author: BTW

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly on the back on my mountain bike. I needed something to carry a spare e-battery for my bike (which I didn't want on my back as it ways 12 lbs), and the battery fit on this perfectly. Couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: CWB1984

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory to my bike
customer_reviews.text: Great accessory to my bike, my main use is for carrying small amount of groceries and with a set of bungees your all set. Easy and simple set up. Durable material, only downside is that there is no real space for strapping on my blinker lights on this. I drilled a small hole to attach my lights for biking at night.
customer_reviews.author: LCS Pro Services

customer_reviews.title: Great light option for bikes
customer_reviews.text: Great light option for bikes. I thought the weight limit would be a problem but so far I have had no problems carrying panniers filled with clothes and/or lunch.
customer_reviews.author: Iain Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Great little add-on.
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in the wife’s mountain bike. Depending on seat height and other attachments like lights and reflectors it may need some maneuvering, but otherwise no issues. If carrying larger items, may suggest one with added bars that attach to the wheel hub for more support.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Put it in my beach cruiser in 10 minutes, put backpack on it and off to races. Easy to install, sturdy and good enough to put daily supplies
customer_reviews.author: MylesD

customer_reviews.title: Needs some man handling.
customer_reviews.text: Screw holes didn't line up and the threads weren't fully cut. Which made installation very difficult. But once it was on it worked great. It tends to swing out overtime on bumpy rides.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Broke almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: It's flimsy and snapped off at the base while on my 3rd ride using it. It didn't even have much weight on it. Ruined my ride. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: matt thomas

customer_reviews.title: Screws were bent needed to go to the hardware store
customer_reviews.text: Would have gave it 5 stars but the screws were bent need to buy 2 new ones
customer_reviews.author: Mustang

customer_reviews.title: Constantly moving
customer_reviews.text: This rack slips and slides sideways and down on the bar no matter how far I tighten it. Need something sturdier to carry my lunch box to work.
customer_reviews.author: ldyamadeus

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to new bike
customer_reviews.text: easy to install and just what was needed to add a carrier to new bike
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeH

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice, solidly constructed rack
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something simple to add to my new GenZe e-bike and this worked well! I had to purchase some longer bolts from my local hardware store since the diameter of my seat pipe was larger than normal, but that was the only modification that was necessary!!! It's a nice, solidly constructed rack!
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: Close to Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This really works well. Easy to install and is very sturdy. Don't think it can be beat.
customer_reviews.author: The Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy strong and reliable product
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice, they say it only holds about 22 lbs , but I’ve gone and put about 50 Lbs and it was still good so I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin I Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: BIKE RACK
customer_reviews.text: Came on time, good shape ,good value for what I'm using it for. I wouldn't put more then the weight limit it calls for
customer_reviews.author: chas

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Used to carry a towel to the beach (strapped on) it also keeps the rear splash off my butt.
customer_reviews.author: John Conner

customer_reviews.title: Slide is a Plus
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this - it can be placed to the desired height location, AND the tray itself can be positioned close to or further away from the seat post, and tightened into place.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Aurelius

customer_reviews.title: 5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ That’s all you Need to know!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product it is very easy to install and it is a very stylish look for any bike. I would give it 10 stars if that was the option.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Turnbull

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: You get what you see, its a very nice quality.
customer_reviews.author: Happy go lucky!

customer_reviews.title: A great value.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this on my bike. No directions are included but its fairly straight forward. Don't forget the rubber pads between the mounting hardware and the seat pole. Also not included is an Allen wrench to fit the screws. I had to slide the rack as far back as possible to use it otherwise some of it was under the seat. But I was able to attach that which was intended with no problems. A great value.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Lamadrid

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks good so far...have not installed or used it yet
customer_reviews.author: jfs

customer_reviews.title: Bolts don't stay tight, but could use some loctite if you don't plan to remove.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great rack. Put it on my mtb and it does it's job. No matter how hard I tighten it, the rack is pretty easy to rotate around the seat stem and I have to tighten it before I ride almost every time. Other than that, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Garland

customer_reviews.title: but that would have been nice. This is easy to mount to the seat ...
customer_reviews.text: I knew the rack didn't include any straps or cords or anything else to hold a tool bag or anything else to it, but that would have been nice. This is easy to mount to the seat post. If you forget to extend it before attaching it, just raise your set long enough to do it, then lower it back down. It doesn't obscure the rear safety light I have attached just below it around the seat post, so that's a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bolts aren't rust-proof, but it's sleek and works well as far as mounting and adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: DavinGreen

customer_reviews.title: Remarkably Convenient!
customer_reviews.text: My mongoose dolomite cruiser fit right over my fat boy 26"!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome piece for the price
customer_reviews.text: Small but does the job. Holds my lunch box and a change of clothes. I wouldn't over load it but it does the trick for sure
customer_reviews.author: c.jernigan

customer_reviews.title: Great mount for extra gear
customer_reviews.text: My son snagged the one we bought for my husband, so I just ordered a second one! The mounting was easy and took just a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MSch

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack while retracted
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my Nashbar road bike. I never extend it and have had zero issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Good but screws need to be longer if your seat post is thicker but still a good product, does what it says.
customer_reviews.author: JUSTMIKE

customer_reviews.title: Good rack, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Good rack for the price. I've used it a couple of weeks now with no problems. A quick release vs the 4 bolts would be a nice design improvement as would a slightly wider platform and a bracket to install a light/reflector. Overall it will do the job though.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Hokanson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality necessary
customer_reviews.text: For a bicycle ride from Maine to Alaska. Good quality necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Louise O. Standish

customer_reviews.title: Great Mount - Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great Mount - Great Value. Hint - slide your entire seat pole out of the bike, add the mount, and then put it back in the bike....duh.
customer_reviews.author: Steelbeach

customer_reviews.title: Good rack
customer_reviews.text: Went right on and feels strong. I just use it for carrying a bag with light stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ron S

customer_reviews.title: Maybe better for a mountain bike style frame
customer_reviews.text: Rides a little high on my road bike frame. My foot hits the bag I strap to it when I swing my leg over the seat. Maybe better for a mountain bike style frame.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a top load bag.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is well made. It's easy to attack and looks great on. I would buy again. If you want to use side bags this is not for you. If you want to have a bag on top it's great for that.
customer_reviews.author: K.J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and safe . they can't steal this unless they're gonna unscrew all 4 which makes it great
customer_reviews.author: Mark Zalzaly

customer_reviews.title: Well made and solid
customer_reviews.text: I like the product very much it is well made. If there was a good modification to make would be a way to mount some of the rear lights to it easier, other than that it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey T. Hill

customer_reviews.title: It did not fit on an Allen or Dagon folding bike Like I hoped
customer_reviews.text: Works well and we'll constructed. Does not fit on folding bikes. It did not fit on an Allen or Dagon folding bike Like I hoped, but I used it on a mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Interesting engineering.
customer_reviews.text: Innovative quality product. Clever design, but its it's too high for my bike. However, it's perfect for a womens cruiser or comfort bike. And that's where it lives today.
customer_reviews.author: waltackerman

customer_reviews.title: Works great for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it just so I could buy food from the Mexican restaurant
customer_reviews.author: Dakota Vaquero

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and formidable. This rack is awesome. I have a bag on the rear that I'm able to keep lots of things in (cameras, snacks etc) and this rack is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell

customer_reviews.title: Only for very, very light loads.
customer_reviews.text: Product came very quick and it was easy to install. It look good; however, it’s probably only good for very light duty. We put a battery (3.8 kg) and even though it is rated for 20 kg it cracked within a few days.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Romero

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: This rack is awesome literally lock it to seat post and go
customer_reviews.author: HOLLIS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Mounts easily and holds my pack well. Looks good on the bike and doesn't interfere with any operations.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: must buy sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome just put it on my bike super easy super sturdy and strong I put my 40 ounce water bottle on the back strap it down with bungee cord went for a bike ride awesome must buy a good price
customer_reviews.author: AmazonQueen

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This rack is supposed to hold up to 22lbs, and I was using it to hold an 8lb speaker. After only 60 miles of riding the support part broke in half. I was 10 miles from home and had to strap everything to my handlebars. I don't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Was not as easy to install as one might think. Is sturdy and resists rust.
customer_reviews.author: EdR

product_meta.title: Outtag Retractable Aluminum Alloy Bike Mount Cycle Bicycle Rear Seat Post Rack (Cling-on Easy Install,max Weight 22lb)
feature_bullets: Made of high quality hard Aluminum Alloy,durable and sturdy
Easy to install,quick-release bag mounting system
Package content: 1 x Aluminum Alloy Bike Mount Cycle Bicycle Rear Seat Post Rack,1 x Allen key，4 x pads for protecting the seatpost from the bike rack.
